com.ui.compute.client

Class ComputeClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ui.compute.client.ComputeClient

  • public class ComputeClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class ComputeClient This is the client class for the distributed processor. To connect to a cluster, instantiate this class with the appropriate IP and port of the master node, call init(...) with all the required parameters and then call start(). To acquire a result unit, call getResultUnit().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComputeClient(java.lang.String masterIP, int masterPort)
      Constructs a new client for the given IP address and port of the master node.

      Closes the connection with the master.

      Returns true if all the result units have been returned by getResultUnit().
      java.lang.Object getResultUnit()
      Returns the next available result unit, blocking until one is available.

      Initialises the client with all the necessary preliminary information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComputeClient

        public ComputeClient(java.lang.String masterIP,
                     int masterPort)
        Constructs a new client for the given IP address and port of the master node.
        Parameters:
        masterIP - the IP address of the master node
        masterPort - the port on which the master node is listening

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(java.net.URL task,
                 java.net.URL[] args,
                 java.net.URL[] dependencies,
                 java.lang.String taskName,
                 java.lang.String[] argNames,
                 java.lang.String[] dependencyNames,
                 java.lang.String packageName,
                 SynchronizedQueue<?> data,
                 int unitSize,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.io.Serializable> params)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                 java.io.IOException,
                 java.net.URISyntaxException,
                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Initialises the client with all the necessary preliminary information.
        Parameters:
        task - the URL of the class file of the custom UnitTask subclass
        args - if input/output types are not in the system library, this is a 2-element array of the URLs of their class files, otherwise {null, null}
        dependencies - an array of the URLs to the class files of any custom classes used
        taskName - the name of the custom UnitTask subclass to execute on the cluster
        argNames - a 2-element array comprised of the simple names of the input and output classes
        dependencyNames - an array comprised of the simple names of any custom classes used (in the same order as in dependencies)
        packageName - the name of the package in which all custom classes are (task, args and dependencies)
        data - the data to be processed
        unitSize - the number of data points to be given to each instance of the custom UnitTask subclass
        params - a list of any additional parameters required by the task
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O problem
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if there is a problem with the URLs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the correct custom classes haven't been specified
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if a blocking queue is interrupted while waiting for a result

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Starts the processor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • done

        public boolean done()
        Returns true if all the result units have been returned by getResultUnit(). This should be used as the condition in a while loop which calls getResultUnit().

      • getResultUnit

        public java.lang.Object getResultUnit()
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Returns the next available result unit, blocking until one is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection with the master. Must be called in a finally block after all processing is done.
